name: Tequila Daisy
instructions:
1. To prepare a coupe or cocktail glass, rim the edge with sugar.
2. Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice and shake until chilled.
3. Strain into the prepared coupe or cocktail glass.
4. Garnish with 3 drops of orange flower water.
description: A Tequila Daisy cocktail recipe from one of Punch's Best New Bartenders fine-tunes the ratios of the classic drink.
garnish: sugar (to rim the glass), orange flower water

ingredients.name: Tequila Blanco
ingredients.description:
Tequila is a distilled alcoholic beverage made from the fermented juice of the blue agave plant, primarily grown in the Jalisco region of Mexico. The production of tequila is regulated by Mexican law, specifying the geographical areas where it can be produced and the methods used in its production.

Tequila Blanco, also known as Tequila Silver or Tequila Plata, is a type of tequila that is typically unaged or aged for a very short period. It is the purest expression of the blue agave flavor, as it is not influenced by the characteristics of aging in oak barrels.

Blanco tequila is a popular choice for those who want to experience the true essence of the agave plant without the influence of aging. It provides a lively and authentic representation of tequila's primary ingredient.

ingredients.name: Cointreau
ingredients.description: Orange-flavoured triple sec liqueur, it was originally called Curaçao Blanco Triple Sec. Usually more dry tasting than Orange Curaçao.

ingredients.name: Lemon juice
ingredients.description:
Lemon juice is a versatile and essential ingredient in many cocktails, prized for its bright, tart flavor and ability to balance sweetness. Extracted from fresh lemons, this citrus juice adds a refreshing zing and acidity that can elevate and harmonize other flavors in a drink.

In cocktails, lemon juice serves multiple purposes. It provides a crisp, clean finish. Its high acidity also helps to cut through rich or sweet components, creating a more balanced and complex taste experience.


When using lemon juice in cocktails, freshly squeezed is always preferred over bottled versions for its superior flavor and aroma. The amount used can vary greatly depending on the recipe, but even a small quantity can significantly impact the final taste of a drink.

ingredients.name: Simple Syrup
ingredients.description:
Simple syrup is a basic sweetener used in cocktails, made by dissolving sugar in water. The standard recipe is a 1:1 ratio of sugar to water, although variations exist, such as rich simple syrup, which uses a 2:1 ratio for a thicker, sweeter result. The syrup is clear and easily mixes with both cold and hot liquids, making it an essential ingredient in many drinks.

Simple syrup can also be infused with additional flavors like herbs, spices, or fruits, adding a layer of complexity to cocktails.
